evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

The airport operator and ATC were notified. Soon after, representatives from the airport operator and the RFFS were on scene. The aircraft sustained substantial damage to the rear of the aircraft, including the APU, which was running at the time.
The TRP on Taxiway Delta is between Stands 61L and 61R. There is a 14.97 m clearance behind a B737-800 and the blast fence when its nosewheel is on the TRP.

The tug instructor stated that the method for getting a tug driver to stop quickly was to raise a clenched first, indicating the driver should apply the tug’s brakes. However, he suggested such a visual signal was not sufficient given a driver would be concentrating on the pushback, with the headset operator often out of his field of view. He did not receive any warning of the impending collision from the wingman or the headset operator.

Trainee tug driver The trainee driver was qualified as a headset operator and wingman, and was aware of the TRP through the training for these roles. This was her second pushback. The first was completed earlier that day, without event.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew occurred during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA flight on 12-25 as documented in hist_t2_interim.

assumptions: Communication/coordination breakdown inferred from lack of warning and incident outcome despite some communication
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, timely communication and coordination preventing the incident
If the collision was caused by external factors unrelated to crew communication

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.
He did not receive any warning of the impending collision from the wingman or the headset operator.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence shows communication channels existed (H1), and some coordination occurred (H2, H3), but lack of warning from wingman or headset operator about impending collision (H8) suggests a breakdown in communication/coordination among crew during the event.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit statement confirming communication breakdown; some communication and coordination is documented but incomplete details on crew interactions.

node.statement: Assess the availability of mechanical and control systems on Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA as of 12-25 during the hist_t2_interim period.

defeaters: Evidence showing mechanical or control system failures or their availability status during the period
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided history items addresses the availability or status of mechanical or control systems on Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the specified period.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features of human factors and crew resource management failures in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25.

assumptions: The tug instructor and trainee driver roles are analogous to crew roles in CRM context
Communication and coordination issues among tug crew are representative of broader human factors failures
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination preventing the incident
If the incident was caused solely by mechanical failure or external factors unrelated to crew communication

quotes.exact_quote: He did not receive any warning of the impending collision from the wingman or the headset operator.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence shows communication signals were insufficient (H8), the trainee stopped and handed over control (H2), and the instructor resumed pushback but the aircraft overran the TRP and hit a barrier (H3, H4), indicating coordination and communication breakdown consistent with human factors and CRM failures.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit analysis linking the communication breakdown to CRM failure frameworks; limited direct evidence of crew resource management failures.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency must be present and identifiable within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA aircraft during the hist_t2_interim period on 12-25.

defeaters: Evidence showing a marking or environmental deficiency present and identifiable on the aircraft during the specified period
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence indicates the presence or identification of an environmental or marking deficiency on the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_t2_interim period on 12-25.

defeaters: If evidence showed the pushback was executed strictly according to procedure without deviation
If no documentation or observation of the deviation existed within the timeframe
